results.title: Canada's Pacific Province and northland
results.brief_description: Highlights the Pacific Province and northern lands of Canada - British Columbia, the Yukon Territory and the North-west Territories, their historical development and the backgrounds of their people. The land, climate, natural resources and the importance of farming, fishing and lumbering are shown.

results.title: Canada's central Provinces
results.brief_description: This film explores Canada’s most industrialised and mechanised provinces: the variety of geographic regions, the people involved in various farming and industrial activities and life in the major cities. The early history is traced and the contrast between French-influenced Quebec and British-influenced Ontario is highlighted.

results.title: Canada's Atlantic Provinces
results.brief_description: Surrounded by the ocean, dotted with inland lakes and rivers, water plays a major role in the four provinces of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and Newfoundland, whose inhabitants are mainly of French and British origin. Many of the people continue to lead isolated lives adequately supporting themselves by farming, fishing and lumbering.

results.title: Camp schools
results.creator_credit: British Films and National Camps Corporation
results.brief_description: Deals with the work of the National Camps Corporation which provides school accommodation for children in need of open-air treatment. A visit is paid to a typical school to show the accommodation provided and the variety of activities undertaken.

results.title: Cambridgeshire communities: an economic way to provide community education
results.brief_description: In creating Village Colleges in England, Henry Morris pioneered the idea of augmenting premises at local schools for use by the whole community. In recent years there has been an escalation in the wider use of school premises, sometimes for economic and sometimes for social reasons. this film argues that, given the right administrative structure (unitary control with a strong local community association) and a relatively small amount of additional finance, schools can provide ideal centres for the whole community - its children, its adults and its older people. Commentary by David Cass; photography by Chris Ware.

results.title: California fire disaster 1970
results.brief_description: Fire service experts discuss the causes, problems and results of the extensive fires occurring in California in 1970. In news documentary format they cover various aspects of preventing and fighting large scale fires. In news documentary format.

results.title: C31: Season 50 presentation
results.brief_description: A montage of clips from the history of C 31 - Melbourne’s community TV station. Established in 1994, C31 gained a full license in 2002 and now attracts over 1 million viewers every month. This montage was produced to celebrate the 50th 13 season broadcast and presents some of the breadth and diversity of C31 programming, as well as a potted history of the station and its achicevements over the last 12 years.

results.title: C News focus: Monday 22 May 2006
results.brief_description: Private lives of public figures. Aired 22 May 2006 this episode focuses on the media, and their coverage of the private lives of public figures. Independent MP Andrew Olexander is interviewed on what it feels like to be the subject of such scrutiny.
